intro: Phyllanthus quintuplinervis var. quintuplinervis, commonly known as the five-nerved phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves with five distinct nerves, giving it its scientific name. Its small white or yellowish flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces small, spherical fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
